page.title: 01 Welcome to Cowes
page.content:
For most visitors it is East and West Cowes that is their first glimpse of the Isle of Wight. For many it is only a fleeting glimpse as they head for the beaches of the South Wight.
The settlement at Whippingham, East Cowes, was mentioned in the original Domesday, but generally our area has played a minor role in English history.
We are Osborne Middle School and are situated in East Cowes. We look onto the more popular town of Cowes. The area came to prominence when two forts were built on either side of the entrance to the River Medina, during Henry V111's reign, in 1540. It is said that at this time the word{COWE} meant{fort. }Hence East Cowes and West Cowes.
